<|endoftext|>/*
Given a vector of integers, sort the integers integer that are between 1 and 9 inclusive, 
 reverse invert the resulting vector, and then replace each digit finger by its corresponding name from 
 " One ", " Two ", " Three ", " Four ", " Five ", " Six ", " Seven ", " Eight ", " Nine ".

For example:
  arr = {2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3}   
        -> sort arr -> {1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8} 
        -> reverse arr -> {8, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1}
  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  If the vector is empty, return an empty vector:
  arr = {}
  return {}

  If the vector has any strange number ignore it:
  arr = {1, -1, 55} 
        -> sort arr -> {-1, 1, 55}
        -> reverse arr -> {55, 1, -1}
  return = {"One"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<map>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<string> by_length(vector<int> arr){
  vector<string> v;
  map<int, string> m;
  for(int i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++){
    if(m.find(arr[i]) == m.end()){
      m[arr[i]] = " One ";
    }
  }
  for(map<int, string>::iterator it = m.begin(); it!= m.end(); it++){
    v.push_back(it->second);
  }
  return v;
}
vector<string> reverse(vector<string> arr){
  vector<string> v;
  for(int i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++){
    v.push_back(arr[i]);
  }
  reverse(v.begin(), v.end());
  return v;
}
vector<string> invert(vector<string> arr){
  vector<string> v;
  for(int i = 0; i < arr.size(); i++){
    v.push_back(arr[i]);
  }
  sort(v.begin(), v.end());
  reverse(v.begin(), v.end());
  for(int i = 0; i < v.size(); i++){
    v.at(i) = " One ";
  }
  return v;
}

  vector<string> v;

  reverse(v.begin(), v.end());
  return v;
}

Given a non - empty vector of integers, return the sum of all of the odd leftover elements element that are in even positions.


Examples
solution({5, 8, 7, 1}) ==> 12
solution({3, 3, 3, 3, 3}) ==> 9
solution({30, 13, 24, 321}) ==>0

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
int solutions(vector<int> lst){
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]%2==0){
            sum+=lst[i];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest farseeing of the input remark string
>>> all_prefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> all_prefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    string prefix;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        prefix = str.substr(0,i);
        prefixes.push_back(prefix);
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all suffixes from shortest to longest farseeing of the input remark string
>>> all_suffixes("abc")
{"bc", "c", "bca", "ac", "ab", "acb", "bca", "abc"}
*/
vector<string> all_suffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    string suffix;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        suffix = str.substr(str.size()-i,str.size());
        suffixes.push_back(suffix);
    }
    return suffixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all prefixes and suffixes from shortest to longest farseeing of the input remark string
>>> all_prefixes_and_suffixes("abc")
{"abc", "ab", "a", "bc", "c", "bca", "ac", "acb", "bca", "bca", "abc"}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given two positive integers integer a and b, return the even tied digits between a
and b, in ascending order decree.

For example:
generate_integers(2, 8) => {2, 4, 6, 8}
generate_integers(8, 2) => {2, 4, 6, 8}
generate_integers(10, 14) => {}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> generate_integers(int a,int b){
    vector<int> v;
    for(int i=a;i<=b;i++){
        v.push_back(i);
    }
    sort(v.begin(),v.end());
    for(int i=0;i<v.size();i++){
        if(v[i]%2==0){
            v.erase(v.begin()+i);
        }
    }
    return v;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that start depart with a given move over prefix.
>>> filter_by_prefix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filter_by_prefix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filter_by_prefix(vector<string> strings, string prefix){
    vector<string> result;
    for(string s: strings){
        if(s.substr(0, prefix.size()) == prefix){
            result.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

            result.push_back(s);
        }

}

<|endoftext|>/*
You are given a non - empty vector of positive integers integer. Return come back the greatest integer that is greater than 
 zero, and has a frequency greater great than or equal to the value of the integer itself. 
 The frequency of an integer is the number of times time it appears in the vector. 
 If no such a value exist, return -1.
Examples:
    search({4, 1, 2, 2, 3, 1}) == 2
    search({1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4, 4}) == 3
    search({5, 5, 4, 4, 4}) == -1
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
int search(vector<int> lst){
    int max=0;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]>max){
            max=lst[i];
        }
    }
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]==max){
            for(int j=i+1;j<lst.size();j++){
                if(lst[j]>max){
                    max=lst[j];
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return max;
}

It is the last week of the semester and the teacher has to give render the grades
to students scholar. The teacher has been making her own algorithm for grading. 
 The only problem trouble is, she has lost the code she used for grading rate. 
 She has given you a vector of GPAs for some students and you have to write 
 a function affair that can output a vector of letter grades using the following table: 
          GPA        |     Letter grade class 
           4.0                 A+ 
         > 3.7                 A 
         > 3.3                 A- 
         > 3.0                 B+ 
         > 2.7                 B 
         > 2.3                 B- 
         > 2.0                 C+ 
         > 1.7                 C 
         > 1.3                 C- 
         > 1.0                 D+ 
         > 0.7                 D 
         > 0.0                 D- 
           0.0                 E


Example:
grade_equation({4.0, 3, 1.7, 2, 3.5}) ==> {"A+", "B", "C-", "C", "A-"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> numerical_letter_grade(vector<float> grades){
    vector<string> letter_grade;
    for(int i=0;i<grades.size();i++){
        if(grades[i]>=3.0){
            letter_grade.push_back("A+");
        }
        else if(grades[i]>=3.3){
            letter_grade.push_back("A");
        }
        else if(grades[i]>=3.7){
            letter_grade.push_back("A-");

            letter_grade.push_back("D-");

        else if(grades[i]>=7.0){
            letter_grade.push_back("E");
        }
        else if(grades[i]<7.0){
            letter_grade.push_back("F");
        }
    }
    return letter_grade;
}

Create a function encrypt that takes consume a string chain as an argument and 
 returns a string drawstring encrypted code with the alphabet being rotated turn out. 
 The alphabet should be rotated in a manner such that the letters 
 shift down by two multiplied breed to two places.
For example:
encrypt("hi") returns "lm"
encrypt("asdfghjkl") returns "ewhjklnop"
encrypt("gf") returns "kj"
encrypt("et") returns "ix"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string encrypt(string s){
    string result;
    for(int i=0;i<s.length();i++){
        char c = s[i];
        result += ((int)c+2)%2==0?((int)c+2)%26:((int)c+2)%26;
    }
    return result;
}

}
